review: This was an impulse buy, just wanted to try it out. Plus I had just cut my cable off because it was pointless to have when i could just stream video from the internet. After reading all the reviews, bad and good, I was a bit skeptical.Then I received it in the mail, hooked it up within minutes....and man this thing rocks! The picture quality is top notch, crystal clear and very easy to use.I read a review that said amazon puts "click bate" to get you to automatically sign up for a service that you don't want. This is false. Maybe it was like that in a older version but not anymore. Also what I REALLY love about the FireTV stick is the parental controls. You can set a 5 pin password, then just "click the boxes" you want to deny access to. So basically, i set it up so that no one can make a purchase or install an App without my password. Problem solved, now no one can accidentally purchase anything.With the FireTV stick, i think its pointless to ever pay for cable again. If you have an amazon prime account its well worth it. $99 for amazon prime for the year; verses $40-100 per month for cable (sometimes more), its a no brainer! Even if you dont have amazon prime, you still have access to Netflix and other apps. Even HBO has an app thats basicly like Netflix but with all HBO content, like the tv series "Game of Thrones". Seriously who needs cable when you have this.I usually dont do reviews, but I liked it so much I had to write a review. Im very happy with my purchase, I think you will be too.
author: xavier palafox

review: Highly disappointed. But I suppose it's my fault for not researching this product more thoroughly. This device does not deliver 1080p. I had my laptop connected to my TV for the longest time because it allowed me to watch 1080p on a big screen. I thought the Fire Stick would be a good idea because I'd be using my laptop less for such applications--I also figured there would be less clutter on my desk with the Stick. The device is compact, easy to take with you anywhere, and has some other nice attributes. Still, I am disappointed with its output. Plus, one would think that if it plugs into the TV's HDMI input, it should be HD! Not only that, but I am constantly seeing the TV stick being used in advertisements without a power cord--you have to plug in this thing for it to work. I assumed the HDMI input would charge the TV Stick. Well, you know what they say happens when you "ASSUME." I am not saying this item is completely terrible, because some will undoubtedly find it useful.
